page.title: 02THE COASTGUARD STATION
page.content: Walton has had a coastguard station in the town for over 100 years,its present site is at the end of East Terrace The new station was built by the side of the old Lookout Station in the late 1970s and with the aid of a wide range of sophisticated equipment it covers the busy stretch of water from Aldeburgh to the Thames including the harbours of Harwich, Felixstowe and Ipswich as well as one of the most popular yachting areas on the coast.The signal that a ship is in distress is relayed to the volunteer lifeboat crew by means of maroons, signal flares that explode high in the sky.The crew then rush to the pier leap onto their ex-G.P.O. bicycles and cycle to the end then row to where the lifeboat is moored.
